description.displayText: Sarah cared for my son for 3 days while I was on a business trip in the area. She was punctual and friendly. I was in a hotel, which is hard for child care, and Sarah rose to the occasion. The issue was pricing. We spoke 3 days before my trip and agreed to an hourly rate. We texted a bit after that, and all seemed fine. When she arrived, Sarah explained that the going rate for sitters was $4 more than what we agreed to  and that was what she was now charging. I said I felt that wasn't fair, and she then lowered the new rate by $2. That night, she texted thanking me for my understanding in increasing the rate by $4 per hour. I reminded her that she had agreed to a lower number, and that's how it ended up. Sarah and I had originally settled on one rate and I felt uncomfortable when she increased the price while already on the job. Then, to try to increase it again seemed like a bit much. She has some great qualities, but I'd recommend putting everything in writing when hiring her.

description.displayText: Sarah is an extremely hard working young lady that is organized and responsible.  She has been babysitting and nannying for families in our hometown for years and has always demonstrated the utmost care for children.  She is a lifeguard and has been caring for children in the pool setting for two years.  She is kind and nurturing.  Any family would be lucky to be able to welcome her into their home to care for their children.
